results.title: The Pursuit of happiness
results.brief_description: Young sales hopefuls Tony and Mary introduce us to self-proclaimed success story Danny, the manager of a door-to-door distribution company. His business philosophy inspires a cult like zeal in his sales team, who battle the hurdles of the working day. Danny is a model and mentor, but is his belief in greed enough? The Pursuit of happiness offers great comic relief in its view of a world where the only measure of success is winning the daily dash for cash.

results.title: The Pursuit of excellence
results.creator_credit: Terry Jennings, South Australian Film Corporation and Scott Hicks
results.brief_description: Part 4 of a series on Australian women artists, examining some of their thoughts, struggles, disappointments, and the effect of sexual discrimination and stereotyping.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Terry Jennings, South Australian Film Corporation and Scott Hicks

results.title: The Purse
results.creator_credit: Guy Glover, ONF | NFB and Patricia Watson
results.brief_description: Deals with the conscience or the lack of it, and what one or the other makes us do. An elderly woman finds a purse on a bus. She takes it home and discovers it contains some money. The woman who lost the purse collects insurance. the quetsion raised is does circumstance excuse taking what is not ours.

results.title: The Purple turtle
results.brief_description: Illustrates the quality of the young child’s engagement with art activities. Designed to capture the excitement art activities offer to the kindergarten child rather than suggest a method of teaching. Presents situations and moments in which the child works with a variety of art material and techniques. Original music composed by Richard Wernick and integrated with children singing and a rhythm band.

results.title: The Purple adventures of Lady Elaine Fairchilde
results.brief_description: Children’s program that uses a combination of performing puppets and musical numbers to describe the purple adventures of Lady Fairchilde and her make believe trip to Jupiter. The colour purple signifies an imaginary place far away and only make believe can send your there - a place called planet purple.

results.title: The Puritan revolution: Cromwell and the rise of parliamentary democracy
results.creator_credit: Irving Allen, Columbia Pictures, Learning Corporation of America and Ken Hughes
results.brief_description: Shows how Parliament’s revolt, led by Cromwell and the puritans, erupts into full-scale civil war. When Charles is executed the absolute power of the monarchy ends and the nation is set on the road to parliamentary democracy. Specially edited from the film ‘Cromwell” starring Richard Harris as Cromwell and Alec Guiness as Charles I.

results.title: The Puffed-up dragon (K)
results.brief_description: Combines delightfully animated paper cutouts and music to tell a story about a huge, hungry dragon who comes to a medieval kingdom and frightens the people because they do not know that he is a vegetarian.
results.description: Combines delightfully animated paper cutouts and music to tell a story about a huge, hungry dragon who comes to a medieval kingdom and frightens the people because they do not know that he is a vegetarian.

results.title: The Public's business
results.creator_credit: Guy Glover, ONF | NFB and Gudrun Parker
results.brief_description: Can a person in public office legitimately use his position for private gain? This question is couched in the language of a teenager as we sit on a committee of high school students planning refreshments for a forthcoming sports day. One boy, employed part-time by his caterer sells them on the idea of having his boss provide the eats. He later brags to a friend that he stands to profit on the deal. His friend objects on ethical grounds. Is he right in his objection?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Guy Glover, ONF | NFB and Gudrun Parker

results.title: The Pub
results.brief_description:
Annabel spent the first 7 years of her life living above her parent’s pub. She reminisces about all the adventures had by her and her siblings as they run amok in their unconventional playground.
You can create your own Digital Story. Ask at the Information Desk or visit www.acmi.net.au/digitalstorytelling
